text: Slint was an American rock band. It was made in 1986. It was made in Louisville, Kentucky. The band's members were Brian McMahan (guitar, singing), David Pajo (guitar), Britt Walford (drums, singing), and Todd Brashear (bass guitar). The band's first album was released in 1989. It is named Tweez. Two years later, the band released Spiderland. Many music critics say this album helped make post-rock and math rock. It inspired many experimental music groups. == References == Category:American rock bands Category:Musical groups established in 1986
title: Slint
